alert.note: Alert for Arthur; Cherry; Grant; Hooker; McPherson; Thomas (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 27 at 4:13PM CDT until April 27 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Arthur County in west central Nebraska... Southeastern Cherry County in north central Nebraska... Eastern Grant County in west central Nebraska... Hooker County in west central Nebraska... Northwestern McPherson County in west central Nebraska... Northwestern Thomas County in north central Nebraska... * Until 500 PM CDT/400 PM MDT/. * At 412 PM CDT/312 PM MDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 15 miles west of Brownlee to 7 miles northwest of Mullen to near Whitman to 14 miles north of Arthur, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and small hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Mullen, Seneca, Brownlee, Swan Lake, Whitman, Duluth, Flatts, Cogill Lake, Marsh Flat, Green Lake, Bucktail Lake, Whitman Road crossing the North Branch of the Middle Loup River, Three Mile Lake, Pratt Lake, Sevenmile Hill, Kelso, Shimmons Lake, Carr Lake, Highway 97 crossing the North Loup River and Lena. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 147 and 204. Highway 61 between mile markers 128 and 156. Highway 92 between mile markers 166 and 189. Highway 97 between mile markers 46 and 92. Highway 83 between mile markers 158 and 169. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Arthur; Cherry; Grant; Hooker; McPherson; Thomas
